title: "Mehbooba Mufti Also Got Burqa Removed": Omar Abdullah's Reminder Amid Row
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, among the first to critcise his Bihar counterpart Nitish Kumar over the hijab row, has hit his political rival Mehbooba Mufti with a throwback.

title: Saudi Arabia Deports 56,000 Pakistani Beggars After Warning To Islamabad
content: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates have tightened scrutiny on Pakistani nationals amid growing concerns over organised begging and criminal activity abroad, a trend Pakistani authorities say is harming the country's international standing.

title: Case Against 2nd Accused In Kerala Actor Assault Case For Defaming Survivor
content: A case was registered against the second accused in the 2017 actress assault case in Kerala for allegedly defaming the survivor on social media, police said on Thursday.

title: "Against Pardah, But...": Javed Akhtar Slams Nitish Kumar Amid Hijab Row
content: Poet-lyricist Javed Akhtar said that he is strongly against the concept of pardah or veil, but cannot accept Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's act of removing a Muslim doctor's veil by "any stretch of imagination"

title: "Woman Can Go To Hell": Giriraj Singh's Shocker On Nitish Kumar Hijab Row
content: Union minister Giriraj Singh, who has emerged as the newest champion of Nitish Kumar in the hijab row, today had a message for the woman who refused to show her face to him.

title: Opinion: Opinion | After Bondi Beach Attack, Some Hard Questions For The Muslim World
content: The Muslim ummah needs to confront the anger, denial and victimhood narratives that create the environment in which extremists begin to believe their violence is righteous.

title: At Priyanka Gandhi-Nitin Gadkari Meet, Bhai-Behen Quip And Dish Cooked By Him
content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's meeting with Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari to press for projects in Kerala saw work, laughter, and some food tasting.

title: 2 Killed, 3 Injured As Truck Rams Tea Shop Amid Dense Fog In UP: Cops
content: Two people, including a truck driver, were killed and three others injured after a truck rammed into a tea shop amid dense fog conditions in the Lambhua area here on Thursday, officials said.

title: "Mother Of Scams": Jagan Reddy Slams Proposed Medical Colleges' Privatisation
content: YSRCP chief and former Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy called the proposed privatisation of medical colleges the "mother of all scams" and said the fight would continue until the decision is withdrawn.

title: Leopard Mauls 5-Year-Old Girl To Death In J&K's Anantnag
content: A five-year-old girl was mauled to death by a leopard in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district, officials said on Thursday.

title: 'Can't Keep Him Like This': Court On Man's Plea To End Son's Life Support
content: An elderly couple has approached the Supreme Court with a petition seeking passive euthanasia for their 31-year-old son, who has been in a vegetative state for the past 12 years after suffering serious injuries in a fall

title: Day After Ethiopia's Top Honour, PM Modi Gets Oman's Highest Award
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Thursday conferred with the Order of Oman, the Sultanate's uniquely distinct civilian honour, by Sultan Haitham bin Tarik for his contributions to strengthening bilateral ties.

title: AAP Sweeps Punjab Zila Parishad Polls, Leads In Panchayat Samitis
content: The ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) swept the zila parishad polls and was also leading in the majority of zones of panchayat samiti in Punjab, according to results declared so far on Thursday.

title: 3 Arrested For Raping, Blackmailing 19-Year-Old Girl In Bengaluru: Cops
content: The Bengaluru South District police arrested 3 men including two students on Wednesday for allegedly raping a 19-year-old college student for two months. According to police, the incident dates back to September and October in Magadi Town.

title: Maharashtra Farmer, Whose Rs 1 Lakh Debt Ballooned To Rs 74 Lakh, Has 1 Kidney: Police
content: A farmer from Maharashtra's Chandrapur district, who had claimed that he was forced to sell his kidney to clear a part of his loan, has only one kidney, police have said, citing his medical examination.

title: Pulitzer-Winner Peter Arnett, Who Reported On Vietnam And Gulf Wars, Dies At 91
content: Peter Arnett, the Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter who spent decades dodging bullets and bombs to bring the world eyewitness accounts of war from the rice paddies of Vietnam to the deserts of Iraq, has died.

title: Indian-Origin Man Rapes 21-Year-Old Woman After She Passes Out In Cab In US
content: An Indian-origin cab driver has been accused of raping an unconscious passenger in California, United States. Simranjit Singh Sekhon, 35, was arrested following an investigation into the sexual assault of a 21-year-old adult female.

title: Medical Complaints, Dubious Documents: Luthras Evade Goa Police's Questions
content: Saurav and Gaurav Luthra, the brothers in Goa Police custody over a fire at a nightclub in Goa that killed 25 people, are evading questions posed by the cops, sources told NDTV.

title: Display of AIADMK banner in Tirumala sparks criticism
content: TTD warns of legal action against the activists, who not only displayed the banner in front of the main temple complex but also filmed and posted it on the social media; the incident also exposes chinks in the vigilance and security mechanism

title: Pothole-ridden Nungambakkam subway turns daily commute into ordeal
content: The subway is a vital point of connectivity in the heart of Chennai city for commuters travelling from E.V.R. Periyar Salai through Nelson Manickam Road to Nungambakkam and T. Nagar

title: Nainar Nagenthran slams DMK government over vacancies in higher educational institutions
content: BJP says information obtained through the Right to Information Act revealed that more than 40% of the sanctioned lecturer posts were vacant in 12 of the 21 State universities

title: Kodikunnil Suresh seeks Mappila Kala Kendra at Charummoodu in Alappuzha
content: He raises the demand in Lok Sabha, highlighting the urgent need to preserve and promote the rich literary and cultural heritage of the Mappila community

title: 7,210 Kudumbashree women race to victory in local body polls
content: 17,082 Kudumbashree members contested the local body elections; Kozhikode has the highest number of winners, 709

title: Kerala SIR: CEO files complaint with cyber police over ‘misuse’ of absentees’ list
content: Kelkar says his office has received information that some people were portraying the list as the final one. The draft roll is scheduled to be released only on Dec. 23

title: Vijay brands DMK an ‘evil force’, positions TVK as people-centric alternative
content: Addressing a campaign meeting near the Vijayamangalam toll plaza in Erode district — his first public address in Tamil Nadu since the September 27 Karur stampede — Mr. Vijay said his political journey was built on long-standing ties with the people, developed over more than three decades

title: IFFK 2025: Taiwanese film Yen and Ai-Lee is a poignant tale about letting go
content: The black and white film directed by Tom Shu-yu Lin explores people’s tendency to pursue abusive relationships and stay in them, despite it hurting them and affecting their personal relationships

title: Retired HC judges ‘embarrassed’ to sit as junior ad hoc judges to clear pendency: CJI
content: Supreme Court gives High Court Chief Justices discretion on Bench composition; flags waste of judicial talent after retirement at 62

title: India signs FTA with Oman, receives zero duty access on 99% of its exports
content: India exported $4.06 billion worth of merchandise to Oman in 2024-25, which made up 0.93% of India’s total exports that year. It imported $6.5 billion worth of goods from Oman, comprising 0.91% of India’s total imports in 2024-25.

title: India excludes dairy, gold, silver, footwear from trade pact with Oman
content: The Commerce Ministry said to safeguard its interest, sensitive products have been kept in the exclusion category by India without offering any concessions

title: Legislative Assembly passes hate speech bill, while BJP members protest Byrathi Suresh’s remark on MLAs from coastal Karnataka
content: The members of the BJP were in a surprise as the Bill was passed, without them being able to join the discussion

title: PM Modi conferred with the Order of Oman
content: This is the latest addition to PM Modi's distinguished list of over 28 highest civilian awards from foreign nations

title: UDF confident of breaking the jinx in Koothattukulam and completing term uneventfully
content: Since elevated to a municipality in 2015, no front has managed to complete a full term in the civic body. This election the UDF has won 16 seats in the 26-member council

title: CM Mamata slams Centre over G RAM G bill, says Bengal’s job scheme will be renamed after Gandhi
content: West Bengal CM said if some political parties “failed to show respect to our national icons, we will do it”, without directly naming the BJP

title: J&K sets up panel to inquire into team's selection process for Santosh Trophy
content: Sports Minister Satish Sharma assured a time-bound and impartial enquiry into the team selection after the BJP alleged discrimination against the Jammu region

title: Kerala SIR: Special drive planned to enrol new voters after draft roll publication on December 23
content: Chief Electoral Officer Rathan U. Kelkar says 2.92 lakh applications in Form 6, which for fresh enrollments, have been received

title: 21st century India takes big, swift decisions, delivers results in time-bound manner: PM Modi in Oman
content: Addressing the gathering of Indian students and the community at the ‘Maitiri Parv’ event, Narendra Modi said that India and Oman are tied not just by geography, but also by generations

title: IFFK 2025 | ‘Shavapetti’ movie review: A disturbing unravelling of trauma responses
content: ‘Shavapetti’ directed by Rinoshun K, screened in the Malayalam Cinema Today category at the 30th IFFK, is a glance into a couple’s life following the loss of their daughter

title: ‘From Vizag’: Rohit Vijjapu’s book chronicles the sights and history of Visakhapatnam
content: Rohit Vijjapu’s illustrated book captures Visakhapatnam through its history, everyday scenes and quietly observed details

title: India resumes visa centre operation in Dhaka, functioning suspended at two others
content: There are five IVAC centres in Bangladesh. Apart from those in Dhaka, Khulna and Rajshahi, the two others are in the northeastern port city of Chattogram and northeastern Sylhet

title: Fear of losing power has ‘rattled’ Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, alleges K. Sudhakaran
content: Former KPCC president says results of Kerala local body elections have ‘shattered the Left’s dream of a third Pinarayi government’

title: Gujarat Deputy CM Harsh Sanghavi inaugurates Ahmedabad Rural Police projects
content: Also the Home Minister of Gujarat, Harsh Sanghavi inaugurated ADR-Shield, Blue Circuit project, Abhayyatri project, and the office of the Aslali Divisional Police Officer

title: WFI makes presence at national camp mandatory; bars wrestlers from training independently
content: Under the new selection policy, failure to attend the camp will make the wrestler "ineligible to participate in the selection trials"

title: Death toll in Yamuna Expressway pile-up at Mathura rises to 19
content: The accident occurred on December 16 when eight buses and two smaller vehicles collided on the expressway, triggering a massive fire

title: Karnataka State Law University recruitment: Committee to be set up, to submit report in two months
content: Minister for Law, Justice, Human Rights, Parliamentary Affairs, Legislation and Tourism H.K. Patil has informed the Legislative Council that a committee would be constituted to look into the issues concerning recruitment for vacant posts in Karnataka State Law University (KSLU) and submit report within two months

title: ‘BRS Govt did some good work, but thin line between welfare and development’: Kavitha
content: The former BRS leader says that a fair bit of misogyny was behind the action taken against her by her party

title: 40 lakh annual FASTag passes issued since August, barrier-free toll collection by 2026: Gadkari
content: Mr. Gadkari said annual FASTag passes will allow private cars to cross 200 toll plazas at ₹3,000 a year, or an average of ₹15 per toll

title: Inside India’s upcoming sustainable PCB factory designed by Studio Saar
content: The upcoming factory in Sehore, Madhya Pradesh, blends passive design, rewilding and regional architecture

title: More donors, but fewer heart and lung transplants in Tamil Nadu as challenges persist
content: Heart and lung transplants lag due to organ-specific challenges such as viability thresholds and limited preservation windows

title: Kerala HC stays proceedings on ED show-cause notice to CM Pinarayi Vijayan, others in KIIFB masala bonds issue
content: Stay order comes on joint petition filed by Pinarayi, former Finance Minister Thomas Isaac and KIIFB CEO K.M. Abraham challenging the show-cause notice

title: Punjab rural polls results: AAP wins over 200 zones of zila parishad, leading in panchayat samiti
content: The Congress was at the second spot with 60 zones, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) at the third position with 39 zones, BJP 4, BSP 3 and Independents 10, as per the results

title: India-Oman free trade pact to give new energy to bilateral relations: PM Modi
content: ‘We are taking such a historic decision, the echo of which will be heard for many decades to come,’ said PM Modi

title: Extend date of submission of SIR enumeration forms, Supreme Court tells ECI
content: The court further listed the hearing on the constitutionality of the SIR on January 6, 2026, after the winter break

title: Bengaluru vs Wildlife: When a growing city meets the forest
content: Increasing urbanisation, metro construction, rising traffic, and pollution are pushing wildlife out of their natural spaces, and leading to more conflicts and injuries in Bengaluru.

title: Anti-India protests in B'desh: Two visa centres closed; rally at consulate - key points
content: India's Dhaka visa application centre has reopened after a temporary closure due to an anti-India protest. However, centres in Khulna and Rajshahi remain shut due to security concerns. India has expressed strong concern to Bangladesh over the deteriorating security environment around its mission.

title: Exodus: Over 2L Indians renouncing citizenship every year; why are they leaving?
content: Nearly a million Indians have renounced their citizenship in five years, with over two lakh annually since 2022. This trend, raises questions about quality of life, governance, and taxation. While the government cites personal reasons and views the diaspora as an asset, the lack of dual citizenship is a key factor driving this significant outflow.

title: Pakistan kabaddi player plays for Indian Team, set to face disciplinary action
content: Pakistani kabaddi star Ubaidullah Rajput faces disciplinary action after donning an Indian jersey at a Bahrain tournament.  Organizers reportedly named private teams after countries, but Rajput claims he was unaware of the team's "Indian" designation.  He apologized, stating he wouldn't represent India, especially given regional tensions. The Pakistan Kabaddi Federation is investigating.

title: I’m not ambitious, just want to stay alive': Nvidia CEO reveals what he fears
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, despite leading a $4.4 trillion company, lives in constant fear of bankruptcy, working seven days a week. He revealed on The Joe Rogan Experience that his mantra is to run Nvidia as if it's "30 days from going out of business," a mindset forged by past near-death experiences.

title: NCP minister quits: Convicted in fraud case; CM Ajit Pawar accepts resignation
content: Maharashtra minister Manikrao Kokate resigned after a court issued arrest warrants in a 1995 housing quota case. Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar accepted the resignation in principle, forwarding it to CM Devendra Fadnavis.  The Governor has now allocated Kokate's former ministries to Pawar. This follows a similar incident with another NCP politician.

title: 'Violent act’ thwarted: Seven arrested in Sydney; no link to Bondi terror shooting
content: Sydney police thwarted a potential violent act on Thursday, arresting seven men in the city's southwest following a tip-off. While the investigation is ongoing, authorities have found no link to the recent Bondi Beach antisemitic shooting. Footage showed officers intercepting vehicles and detaining suspects.

title: How Indian-origin Ramaswamy decides who is 'American'
content: Ramaswamy’s core claim is classically conservative and quietly radical in today’s climate: Americanness is binary. You are either American or you are not. There are no gradations based on skin colour, ancestry, or how early your family arrived.

title: Musk vs Gates: Tesla short bet sparks new clash; claims loss may top $10 bn
content: Elon Musk has again targeted Bill Gates, suggesting the Microsoft founder may have lost over $10 billion due to a significant short bet against Tesla. Musk highlighted Gates' wager against the electric carmaker, stating it was placed during a vulnerable period for Tesla. This ongoing public spat underscores the billionaires' contrasting views on Tesla's future.

title: Journey to hell & back: Odisha man held as 'spy' in conflict-torn Sudan returns home
content: An Odia man's hope for a better life in Sudan turned into a nightmare when civil war erupted, leading to his capture by paramilitary forces. After enduring months of hardship and captivity, he was finally rescued and returned home, thanks to the intervention of the Indian government and international organizations.

title: BCCI not responsible for Lucknow T20I ticket refunds: Secretary Saikia
content: Spectators of the abandoned India-South Africa T20I in Lucknow will receive refunds, confirmed BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia. The Uttar Pradesh Cricket Association (UPCA) will manage reimbursements for the match called off due to dense fog and poor visibility. Saikia highlighted the unpredictable nature of winter weather, noting this was an exceptional situation despite BCCI's efforts to reschedule domestic games.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5% of its Luxembourg workforce, impacting software developers as the company embraces AI. This reduction follows a global layoff of 14,000 employees and comes after negotiations resulted in a reduced number from the initial plan. Despite the cuts, Amazon reaffirms Luxembourg as a strategic European partner.

title: Global campuses in India could cut foreign education expenses by billions: What it means
content: Foreign universities are no longer just a policy dream in India—they are turning into campuses, classrooms and choices. The promise is tempting: global pedagogy, less visa anxiety, and a lower overall cost than studying abroad. But the fine print matters. If fees soar and campuses cluster in metros, this “global upgrade” could deepen divides rather than deliver broad-based gains.

title: Clash of egos: Is GCL making chess players talk as teams?
content: The Global Chess League is transforming the individual sport into a team setting, challenging the traditional solitary nature of chess. Players from diverse backgrounds are now sharing jerseys and coaches, fostering interaction and fun. This shift encourages communication and collaboration, proving that even in a fiercely competitive arena, greatness doesn't have to be a lonely pursuit.

title: G RAM G Bill gets LS nod: What is it - and why is opposition protesting
content: Lok Sabha passed the Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, replacing MGNREGA with a 125-day wage employment guarantee for rural households. Opposition protested, calling it an attack on Gandhi's legacy and accusing the government of undermining rural development. Supporters claim it will boost villages and deter corruption.

title: Tua Tagovailoa net worth 2025: Contracts, endorsements and earnings
content: Tua Tagovailoa's NFL journey has transformed him from a debated prospect to a franchise cornerstone.  By 2025, his substantial earnings from a lucrative Dolphins contract and a diverse endorsement portfolio, including Adidas and EA Sports, have propelled his net worth to an estimated $30-$40 million, solidifying his financial elite status.

title: Ghaziabad woman goes to collect rent from tenants, found dead in suitcase
content: A Ghaziabad woman was tragically found dead in a suitcase under a bed in her rented flat. She had reportedly gone to collect overdue rent from her tenants, a couple who have since been detained. The discovery was made by her domestic help after the victim failed to return home. Police are investigating the motive and cause of death.

title: Dec 18 throwback: When 16-year-old Sachin began his ODI journey — and cricket found a legend
content: Thirty-six years ago today, a 16-year-old Sachin Tendulkar made his ODI debut against Pakistan, facing a formidable Waqar Younis and departing for a duck. This anti-climactic start belied a legendary career that would see him become cricket's highest ODI run-scorer. The rain-affected match saw India narrowly lose by seven runs.

title: Up to 7 yrs jail, Rs 50k fine: K'taka cracks down on hate speech; BJP raises objection
content: Karnataka Assembly passed a hate speech bill despite BJP protests. The legislation defines hate speech broadly, aiming to curb expressions causing disharmony or enmity. It includes provisions for jail terms and victim compensation. Exemptions exist for public interest and good faith acts. The government asserts it's crucial for maintaining peace and order.

title: Michaela Benthaus set to become first wheelchair user in space
content: German aerospace engineer Michaela Benthaus, a wheelchair user since 2018, is set to make history as the first person with a disability to travel to space. She will join five others on Blue Origin's 37th New Shepard mission, a suborbital flight offering a glimpse of Earth from above. This flight highlights increased accessibility in space exploration.

title: TER cut: Think your mutual fund got cheaper? Read the fine print
content: SEBI's mutual fund TER changes are a transparency reset, not just a fee reduction. By unbundling costs and separating levies, SEBI aims for clearer investor understanding. Tightened brokerage caps and removed exit load charges offer potential real savings beyond the headline number.

title: With shrinking wetlands, rising climate risks, is Chennai ready for the next flood?
content: Chennai's vulnerability to floods was highlighted again as heavy rains submerged parts of the city, causing damage and disruption. Despite significant investment in stormwater drains, experts warn that encroachments on canals and rivers, along with desilting issues, continue to impede water flow, leaving the city at risk.

title: Dhurandhar box office day 14: Ranveer film slows; Avatar advance buzz
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, with its second weekend surpassing the first and becoming the biggest second weekend grosser, even beating 'Pushpa 2'. The film has now crossed Rs 674 crore worldwide, surpassing 'Baahubali's lifetime collection. Domestically, it has reached Rs 440.78 crore, though a slowdown is now evident as 'Avatar Fire And Ash' gains momentum.

title: Rapid weight loss, advised more rest: Yashasvi Jaiswal's health update | Exclusive
content: India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal is recovering from acute gastroenteritis after being hospitalised during Mumbai’s Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match in Pune. The left-hander suffered rapid weight loss of 2.5 kg and has been advised complete bed rest for 7–10 days. His availability for Mumbai’s early Vijay Hazare Trophy matches remains uncertain, with the BCCI medical team monitoring his recovery.

title: Shocker! 27,397 births in 3 months in a village of 1,500
content: A Yavatmal village with 1,500 residents registered an astonishing 27,397 births in three months, triggering alarm bells for a massive cyber fraud. The village's Civil Registration System ID was found mapped in Mumbai, with most registered individuals reportedly from other states. Authorities have launched a thorough investigation and are canceling the suspicious entries.

title: Portraits of US Presidents at White House: Trump adds plaques mocking Biden, Obama
content: President Trump has installed bronze plaques under presidential portraits at the White House, featuring his personal, often critical, commentary on predecessors. Many inscriptions, reportedly penned by Trump, label Joe Biden "the worst President in American History" and Barack Obama "one of the most divisive political figures," reflecting his efforts to customize the White House with his opinions.

title: Jaxson Dart’s rumored girlfriend Marissa Ayers shines as ring girl at Netflix showdown
content: Marissa Ayers has surged into the spotlight as NFL buzz and boxing spectacle collide. Linked to Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart, the Alabama alum now headlines as lead ring girl for Jake Paul’s Netflix fight against Anthony Joshua, blending quiet confidence, growing influence, and perfectly timed visibility on a massive stage.

title: India's hiring story in 2025 was less about speed, more about skills
content: India’s job market ended 2025 with strong but disciplined growth, as hiring rose 23% year-on-year before moderating in the second half, according to Foundit data. Employers prioritised productivity, leadership, and digital skills, while Tier-2 cities gained prominence. The outlook for 2026 points to steady, skills-led hiring across sectors and geographies.

title: Bondi Beach shooter’s India trail: Sajid Akram visited Hyderabad 6 times since 2001
content: Investigations into the Bondi beach attack reveal alleged shooter Sajid Akram's six visits to Hyderabad were personal, focusing on family and property. Indian authorities found no suspicious activity or overseas links during his trips. Preliminary findings suggest any radicalization of Sajid and his son Naveed occurred abroad, with Australian agencies probing further details.

title: IND vs SA: 'Stop winter cricket in North India' - Shukla sounds alarm after Lucknow T20I
content: A thick blanket of smog forced the abandonment of the India-South Africa T20I in Lucknow, prompting the BCCI to reconsider winter scheduling in North India. Vice-president Rajeev Shukla called the air pollution an "emergency," signaling a potential policy shift. Concerns over player safety and hazardous AQI levels led to the match's cancellation, with a series decider now set for Ahmedabad.

title: Squinting gestures: Row erupts over Finland MPs mocking posts; PM Petteri Orpo apologises
content: Finland's Prime Minister Petteri Orpo has apologized to Japan, China, and South Korea after several Finns Party MPs posted offensive squinting gestures on social media. The actions, intended to support a former Miss Finland, have drawn widespread condemnation and impacted international collaborations. The Prime Minister's office stressed that these actions do not represent Finland's official stance on equality and inclusion.

title: IPL auction: KKR’s mystery pick Kamra mirrors Chakravarthy, impresses Nayar - Exclusive
content: KKR’s Rs 30-lakh signing Daksh Kamra is already drawing comparisons with Varun Chakravarthy for his mystery spin and similar bowling patterns. The 22-year-old Haryana all-rounder, who clocks 95–97 km/h googlies and packs power-hitting ability, has impressed coaches and scouts, including Kumar Sangakkara and Abhishek Nayar, after a rapid rise through the under-23 ranks.

title: Ashes: 'Worst technology ever' — Starc slams Snicko as fresh controversy erupts
content: The snickometer faced intense scrutiny during the third Ashes Test after controversial decisions involving Alex Carey and Jamie Smith.  Australian bowler Mitchell Starc branded the technology "the worst ever" after Smith was reprieved despite a visible glove movement.  Further confusion arose when Snicko later ruled Smith out, highlighting its unreliability.

title: Trump’s Gold Card finds no takers? $1 mn visa scheme sees muted interest
content: US President Trump's $1 million "Gold Card" visa program is facing a lukewarm reception in India. Wealthy Indians are reportedly shying away due to a lack of clarity on permanent residency and citizenship pathways. Instead, the established EB-5 investor visa,  remains the preferred route for aspiring Americans.

title: Jake Paul vs Tommy Fury scripted claims resurface amid Anthony Joshua allegations
content: Jake Paul is facing fight-fixing claims once again. This time, the allegations surround his December 2025 bout against Anthony Joshua. Deontay Wilder made these claims, prompting a legal threat from Paul. Previously, a leaked document suggested a fixed outcome for his fight against Tommy Fury. The promoters debunked the rumors. Both Paul and Joshua now have denied that the Joshua fight is fixed.

title: Growth over 8%! PM Modi highlights Indian economy in Muscat; set to sign India-Oman FTA
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted the historical depth of India-Oman trade ties at the India-Oman Business Forum, emphasizing deeper economic collaboration ahead of a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). The CEPA aims to boost bilateral trade beyond $10 billion by offering duty-free trade and removing barriers, positioning Oman as a strategic gateway for Indian businesses.

title: Delhi 50% WFH: Why it may be easier said than done
content: Delhi's 50% work-from-home directive under GRAP has caused confusion among office-goers, with many unaware or unsure of its implementation. While some firms are adapting, smaller businesses cite manpower and resource limitations, leaving the actual impact and enforcement uncertain.

title: Goa nightclub fire probe: Cops term Luthras flight risk; Mapusa court turns down duo’s demand for mattress
content: Owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, where 25 died in a fire, were remanded in five-day police custody. Goa police sought custody to uncover financial transactions, prevent further illegal operations, and identify associates. The Luthra brothers had fled India after the incident but were arrested upon their return.

title: Bomb threats trigger evacuations at Bombay HC, other Mumbai courts; premises ‘safe’ after searches
content: Proceedings at the High Court were temporarily halted and are expected to resume at 3 p.m. after clearance

title: Pune municipal polls: NCP(SP) aligning with Ajit Pawar’s would be like joining hands with BJP, says Sanjay Raut
content: Elections to the 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra will take place on January 15, 2026 and the counting will be held a day later

title: Meghalaya MP urges Centre to fast-track scientific coal mining, warns of rise in drug smuggling
content: The MP highlighted that the ban has crippled autonomous district councils in the State, which relied on coal as their primary source of revenue

title: Raghav Chadha demands Copyright Act amendment to protect digital content creators
content: Raising the issue during Zero Hour in Rajya Sabha, the AAP MP from Punjab said millions of Indians have become digital content creators, functioning as educators, reviewers, satirists, entertainers, musicians and influencers.

title: Stray dogs case: We will play video, ask you what is humanity, Supeme Court tells petitioner
content: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal responded that they will also play a video to show what was happening; next hearing on the matter is on January 7

title: IndiGo's focus now on resilience, root cause analysis, rebuilding: CEO Pieter Elbers
content: Attributing the disruptions seemingly to a "compounding effect of several factors," the CEO said, "an external aviation expert has been appointed by the Board to conduct a comprehensive root cause analysis"

title: T.N. DGP calls for complete eradication of orderly system
content: Ensure that no orderly is posted to the residence of serving or retired police officers: Abhay Kumar Singh

title: Suo motu case booked against Lulu Mall management after actor Nidhhi Agerwal mobbed by unruly crowd
content: Police said further investigation is under way to ascertain lapses in crowd control and security arrangements

title: CM Stalin writes to PM Modi seeking resolution of U.S. tariffs hitting Tamil Nadu exports
content: The tariffs have translated into a “combined daily loss of ₹60 crore in revenue” for exporters across various districts of Tamil Nadu, he said

title: Sculptor Ram Sutar death: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy CMs pay tributes
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said Sutar’s art would endure for generations and that every viewing of his sculptures would evoke his memory

title: Two arrested in connection with journalist’s murder in Dehradun
content: The complainant stated that on the night of December 15 at around 10 p.m., Amit Sehgal, along with some other people, allegedly formed a gang and came to Pankaj Mishra's rented house in Doon Vihar

title: Should be stopped immediately: Kuki outfit warns against cyclist's peace expedition in Kangpokpi
content: Malem Thongam embarked on her 'Cycling for Manipur Peace' expedition from the Qutub Minar in Delhi on October 2, 2025

title: Schools up to Class 8 to remain shut for three days amid ‘orange’ alert for dense fog in U.P.’s Bareilly
content: The administration has advised people to avoid unnecessary travel and take special care of children and the elderly, as no immediate relief from the cold spell is in sight

title: Opposition MPs hold protest march in Parliament complex, demand withdrawal of VB-G RAM G bill
content: The Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) (VB-G RAM G) Bill to replace the UPA-era MGNREGA (Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act) is being debated in Parliament

title: Kerala Vice-Chancellors appointment row: Supreme Court told that Governor reached out to CM Vijayan
content: The Bench termed the prolonged stand-off between the Governor, who is also Chancellor of the two universities, and the Kerala government a “saga” in which the ultimate stakeholders, the students, suffer

title: GRAP-IV in Delhi: what is allowed and what is banned in the Capital as toughest anti-pollution measures kick in?
content: Starting Thursday (December 18), vehicles without a valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificate will not be allowed to refuel at petrol pumps; all private, government offices must follow mandatory 50% work from home

title: Wrong blood transfusion at Bikaner hospital prompts inquiry
content: According to hospital sources, the patient was admitted due to severe anaemia and was undergoing blood transfusion when a unit of an incompatible blood group was allegedly transfused

title: Parliament Winter session Day 14 LIVE: Rajya Sabha debates new Nuclear Bill- SHANTI
content: Lok Sabha passes MGNREGA's replacement - Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission Gramin (VB-G Ram G) Bill, 2025

title: Messi fiasco in Kolkata: Abhishek Banerjee defends West Bengal CM Mamata, government
content: LoP Suvendu Adhikari barred from entering Salt Lake Stadium; four-person Special Investigation Team visits stadium and probes into last week’s vandalism

title: Lamborghini zips at 252 kmph on Mumbai’s Bandra-Worli Sea Link; car seized, FIR filed
content: The incident took place on December 12, and a case has been registered against the car driver, who is yet to be identified

title: BJP leader Chalavadi Narayanaswamy accuses Karnataka Minister Krishna Byregowda of landgrab; Minister says it is ancestral property
content: The Minister explained that the land is ancestral property that he had inherited from his grandfather

title: Watch: PM Modi arrives in Oman on final leg of three-nation visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Oman on December 17 for a two-day visit to strengthen bilateral ties. He will hold talks with Omani leadership and is expected to finalise a free trade agreement. The visit marks 70 years of India–Oman diplomatic relations.

title: Bengal BJP makes public a report blaming Trinamool regime for State’s industrial decline
content: The BJP released the document a day before West Bengal government is likely to hold a high-level business conclave in Kolkata on December 18 to highlight the state’s industrial progress and new investment prospects

title: Air India Express Flight from Jeddah makes ‘precautionary’ landing in Kochi after tyre burst
content: Kozhikode-bound flight carrying 160 passengers was diverted to Kochi airport. Post-landing inspection confirmed that both right-side tyres had burst

title: Cyber police book Kerala actor rape case convict for video revealing survivor’s identity
content: Video, believed to be shot when Martin Antony was out on bail, was shared on his Facebook page and began circulating widely on social media after a sessions court convicted the first six accused in the case earlier this month

title: Vijay to address TVK campaign meeting in Erode
content: The meeting is part of Mr. Vijay’s revised “Meet the People” Statewide tour, resumed after an 81-day break following the stampede at a rally in Karur on September 27, in which 41 persons died

title: Sculptor Ram Sutar, designer of Statue of Unity, passes away
content: The iconic statues of Mahatma Gandhi seated in a meditating pose and of Chhatrapati Shivaji riding a horse on  the Parliament premises rank among his finest creations

title: BRICS shifts gears as Brazil passes the gavel to India amid global tensions and ambitious goals
content: Brazil’s presidency of BRICS was punctuated by the aftereffects of multiple wars and Trump’s slew of tariffs, among other challenges; yet, it worked towards sustainability and inclusive development, effectively steering the group through the calamity; India’s chapter is set to continue on this path

title: With freebies, OpenAI, Google vie for Indian users and training data
content: OpenAI, Google and Perplexity have begun an unprecedented fight for artificial intelligence users in India

title: PNB scam: Belgium top court endorses lower court view; no risk of denial of justice to Choksi in India
content: India has given a number of assurances to Belgium regarding Choksi's safety, the charges that he would face during trial in India, prison arrangements, human rights and medical needs

title: Congress protests in Chhattisgarh against ‘misuse of investigating agencies’
content: Congress party staged protests outside the BJP office following the court’s dismissal of the ED’s charge sheet in the National Herald case.

title: Delhi HC questions government over failure to regulate sale of old vehicles
content: A Bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Tushar Rao Gedela asked the Delhi government to file a detailed response on the issue of regulating authorised dealers of registered vehicles

title: Indians ‘cut off’ from internet in flights, Maran complains; Telecom Minister says norms in works
content: DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran complained of India being one of the few places globally “cut off” from in-flight WiFi; communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said that norms in this regard were being worked out

title: Webinar on Career Compass on December 21
content: The webinar will seek to offer clarity on career pathways beyond academics for students across disciplines, with a focus on real-world readiness, innovation, and adaptability to evolving landscapes

title: Two emerge as strong contenders for N. Paravur municipal chairperson post
content: The main criteria for consideration for all posts are seniority and long-term affiliation with the United Democratic Front

title: Farmers give 20-day ultimatum for closure of ethanol plant in Hanumangarh
content: Farmers in the region fear that the factory would create a livelihood crisis by making the agricultural land barren through groundwater contamination and air pollution.

title: Return votes first: male beneficiaries of Bihar scheme for women
content: The Bihar Rural Livelihoods Promotion Society, an autonomous body under the Department of Rural Development better known as JEEViKA, had sent notices to the male recipients asking them to return the amount after the mistake came to light

title: Bombay HC allows Gautam Navlakha to relocate to Delhi, sets strict conditions
content: The court, however, directed that he must attend proceedings before the special NIA court in Mumbai whenever required.

title: Despite conflicts, we used the bureaucracy’s experience to implement policies: Shailaja
content: At the launch of the Tamil translation of her book, the former Kerala Health Minister spoke of her association with then Health Secretary and their work to implement the e-Health Project in Kerala

title: IND vs SA: 'No cricket...AQI 411' - Tharoor’s stinging post after Lucknow T20I is lost to smog
content: The fourth T20I between India and South Africa in Lucknow was abandoned without a ball bowled due to persistent fog and poor air quality. Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor criticized the venue selection, highlighting the hazardous AQI and suggesting Thiruvananthapuram as a better alternative. Player welfare concerns were amplified as Hardik Pandya was seen wearing a mask during warm-ups.

title: Anbumani questions DMK’s failure to conduct caste survey
content: Speaking at a protest, he said the caste-wise survey was essential to protect the 69% reservations in place in Tamil Nadu, ensure proper delivery of government schemes

title: Two more Indians killed in Russia-Ukraine war zone, bodies arrive at Delhi airport
content: The deceased, Ajay Godara and Rakesh Kumar, had gone to Russia on student visa but were allegedly enlisted in the Russian Army after being misled by agents who promised them work as cleaners and helpers

title: Provide proper facilities for disabled and aged voters at Tamil Nadu, Puducherry polling stations: Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan insist on implementing Election Commission of India’s 2023 instructions in letter and spirit

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the 2025-26 College Football Playoff
content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: Bears expand stadium search to include Indiana
content: The Chicago Bears are exploring locations for a new stadium outside the city and even outside Illinois after multiple plans hit stumbling blocks over concerns about the cost to taxpayers.

title: U.S. gov't admits role in crash that killed skaters
content: The U.S. government admitted that the actions of an air traffic controller and Army helicopter pilot played a role in causing the January collision between an airliner and a Black Hawk that killed 67 people, including a number of young figure skaters.

title: Michigan to 'act swiftly' if findings warrant firings
content: Michigan's investigation into its football program and athletic department could lead to findings of additional misconduct that might trigger more terminations, interim president Domenico Grasso said Wednesday.

title: NCAA slams Kalshi's intent to offer portal trading
content: Prediction market Kalshi filed notice to the Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Wednesday that it intends to offer trading on the transfer portal, prompting the NCAA to say it "vehemently opposes college sports prediction markets."

title: 7-foot-9 Florida C Rioux dunks for first field goal
content: The tallest college basketball player ever recorded his first field goal in the 23rd-ranked Gators' win over Saint Francis on Wednesday night.

title: Ohio fires coach Smith over 'serious' misconduct
content: Ohio University has fired football coach Brian Smith for cause, saying he violated his contract by "engaging in serious professional misconduct and participating in activities that reflect unfavorably on the University."

title: Burrow on Bengals future: 'Crazy things happen'
content: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow was asked Wednesday if he ever envisioned playing for another franchise.

title: Green Bay's Gottlieb taking break from radio show
content: Green Bay's Doug Gottlieb says he's stepping away from his radio show to put his total focus on his coaching responsibilities.

title: 📈 Reranking NCAAM's top 10 FOY contenders
content: North Carolina's Caleb Wilson rounds out a solid top three while three new names crack the latest edition.

title: Let's simulate the rest of the 2025 NFL season: The past three weeks, plus playoff and Super Bowl results
content: We used the ESPN Football Power Index's most likely simulation to project Weeks 16, 17 and 18 -- and how the NFL playoff field could stack up.

title: How Tua Tagovailoa's benching impacts Dolphins' future
content: Will Dolphins part ways with Tagovailoa or his contract prohibitive? Did Mike McDaniel fail with Tagovailoa?

title: Power Rankings: It's Arizona vs. Michigan for No. 1
content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

title: Power Rankings: Louisville in, UNC out of top 16
content: Has Louisville emerged as the ACC favorite? The Cardinals break into the poll ahead of Saturday's clash with Tennessee.

title: Bracketology: Five contenders -- and everyone else
content: UConn, Texas, South Carolina and UCLA remain 1-seeds -- and LSU is the only real challenger behind them.

title: Miami's Malachi Toney is ready for prime time
content: The freshman receiver, who should be in his final year of high school, has instead been a highlight machine for the Hurricanes.

title: 'M.O.B. Ties': How Mike Macdonald rebuilt the Seahawks' winning culture
content: The Seahawks face the Rams Thursday for a battle of first place in the NFC. Macdonald has his team ready to compete.

title: Linebackers Jared Verse, Byron Young driving Rams' defense

title: Geek and destroy: How Bruins winger Morgan Geekie has defied goal-scoring regression
content: Many expected the 27-year-old to take a step back from his 33 goals last season. Instead, he's on pace for 58.

title: How NFL teams complain to the league about officiating calls
content: John Harbaugh grumbling about an overturned TD is an example of why the NFL pays attention to complaints.

title: The unlikeliest journey to NCAA volleyball's final four
content: Kyndal Stowers was medically retired because of concussions before transferring to Texas A&M. After helping the Aggies oust No. 1 Nebraska, she's ready to star in the final four.

content: The Aggies head into their first College Football Playoff appearance looking to banish the program's ghosts.

title: The 'what ifs' that could've won Verstappen, Piastri the F1 title
content: Buying into counterfactuals is unwise but entertaining, and these "what if" moments could well have won Max Verstappen or Oscar Piastri the F1 title.
